Authors:
Viacheslav Spirin, Vera F. Malysheva, Peter Roberts, Gérard
Trichies, Anton Savchenko, Karl-Henrik Larsson
Title:
A convolute diversity of the Auriculariales (Agaricomycetes,
Basidiomycota) with sphaeropedunculate basidia
Abstract:
Morphological and DNA data show that effused
representatives of the Auriculariales (Basidiomycota) with
sphaeropedunculate basidia belong to eleven genera of which seven are
dealt with in this study. Among them, Myxarium is the largest genus
containing 21 accepted species of which nine are reintroduced below and
five are described as new. Protodontia is limited to three species only,
P. subgelatinosa (generic type) and two newly described species from
Africa. Protoacia is a new monotypic genus for P. delicata, sp. nov.,
widely distributed on coniferous hosts in Eurasia. Myxariellum is
erected for two new species with smooth hymenophore from northwestern
North America while Gelacantha is introduced for G. pura, a new species
with hydnoid hymenophore from Caucasus. Our data do not confirm the
present synonymy of Sebacina sphaerospora with Tremella glaira, and
these species are placed in two separate genera  Hydrophana, gen. nov.,
and Ofella, gen. nov., respectively. This article is protected by
